definition: Bollywood (film industry based in Mumbai, India)
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album

sentences.chinese: 宝莱坞的造梦者们被震惊了。

sentences.english: Stardom in the entertainment industry is very fickle, and Bollywood is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐业中的明星制是变化无常的，宝莱坞也不例外。

sentences.english: Damian:Bollywood is really unique with its troops of dancers and vivid colors.
sentences.chinese: 成群的舞者，饱满的颜色，宝莱坞真的很有特色。

sentences.english: Students follow an instructor’s movements in a Bollywood dance class.
sentences.chinese: 在宝莱坞舞蹈班上，学生们跟着老师一起舞动。

sentences.english: And here in India, we only have stupid Bollywood.
sentences.chinese: 印度只有看了会让人犯傻的宝莱坞电影拿得出手。

sentences.english: She has really worked hard and has become the most demanded bollywood actress in the world.
sentences.chinese: 她真的努力，并已成为世界上最要求宝莱坞女演员。

sentences.english: Bollywood movies are the most popular form of entertainment across the subcontinent.
sentences.chinese: 宝莱坞电影是整个次大陆地区最受欢迎的娱乐形式。

sentences.english: Thousands of aspiring artists flock to Bollywood. Photograph by William Albert Allard
sentences.chinese: 成千上万有抱负的艺术家蜂拥而入宝莱坞。

sentences.english: However, Salman Khan was an exception and was still shining in Bollywood.
sentences.chinese: 可萨尔曼汉是个例外他依旧闪耀宝莱坞。

sentences.english: Now I finally understand why Bollywood movies are so popular in India.
sentences.chinese: 我现在终于明白为什么宝莱坞在印度如些出名了。

sentences.english: Hollywood is famous all over the world, while Bollywood is always ignored.
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞世界各地都很出名，而宝莱坞总是被忽略。

definition: (of a movie, show etc) to attract large audiences
Telugu or Telegu, the official language of Andhra Pradesh, India
